subject: Re: Heath's Details
preview: Hi Allan,  Heath has advised the clearance page cant be restored and needs to be rebuilt. Refer to email below as something in that page is conflicting with the theme so keeps showing error.  If I sim

full_threads.body:
Hi Allan,

Heath has advised the clearance page cant be restored and needs to be rebuilt.
Refer to email below as something in that page is conflicting with the theme so keeps showing error.

If I simply duplicate the 'in stock' template again and start the same way as before, I assume the same issue will occur?

Allan, can you please advise how I should proceed with getting something up for this going live tomorrow.

Warm regards
Jess Leonard
Showroom Manager
Osier Belle Pty Ltd
24 Young Street
(located on Grosvenor Street)
Neutral Bay, NSW 2089
(02) 9949 9466
http://www.osierbelle.com.au/
ABN: 84 147 254 082

Hi All,

Just closing the loop on this one, Jess has managed to renew the domain name and the site is live again.

Hi Jess,

As mentioned, it appears the domain name is due for renewal, here is the email address associated with domain name account:
ebabestrading@gmail.com

Likely registered with ventraIP.com.au or https://synergywholesale.com/

Hi Allan,

I know when we just spoke on the phone that you had issues accessing the back end, looks like I can not either now.
Receiving this message



Warm regards,
Jess Leonard
Showroom Manager
Osier Belle Pty Ltd
24 Young Street
(located on Grosvenor Street)
Neutral Bay, NSW 2089
(02) 9949 9466
http://www.osierbelle.com.au/
ABN: 84 147 254 082

Hi Health

Thanks for your help

Jess and I are still getting the critial error when trying to open that template using BB

Cheers

Hi Allan,

We have resolved the max memory issue by redefining the script in a way that better works with this website.

The Clearance page is still buggy when editing. We recommend you create a new page and recreate this content. Don't duplicate it as the issue that has been caused will be carried through.

When we enabled the ASTRA theme, we could use Beaver Builder as normal. As soon as the custom theme is enabled, Beaver Builder doesn't work. This strongly leans towards the custom theme having an issue.

My recommendation would be for you to rebuild the custom theme OR to build on top of the ASTRA theme (matching the styling of the custom theme). It's not practical for yourself or Penny's team to have to toggle between themes to make edits. I also acknowledge that your team (or our team) did not code this custom theme. The responsibility largely lies with them. Now unfortunately, it needs to be fixed retrospectively.

We can help, but not by tomorrow's sale. It would be an extensive process to get the site functioning as expected. Are you able to jump in and help Penny's team get the sale content live in time?

Let me know if you need any more info at this stage?

Hi Heath

Yes, I never went down that route. Just continued with the Astra work around which worked okay until it didn't

As I didn't develop the theme my preference would have been to replace it down the track.

Will send via WeTransfer

Cheers

Thanks for the insight Allan,

That's something that should really be fixed up as it indicates a conflict exists somewhere in the theme and BB.

Can I ask you to please send your beaver builder logins? We want to download a fresh copy of the plugin and see if that helps.

Hi Heath

Beaver Builder doesn't work with the custom Osier Belle theme.

To get it to load you need to activate a standard WordPress theme (have Astra loaded). Once BB is loaded you can switch back to the default.

Generally speaking BB works okay. Just returning critical errors when Jess tries to build out a larger page/template.

Cheers

Ok thanks Allan,

We can see that beaver builder is crashing, so it's the likely culprit. At this stage we are thinking it could be a plugin conflict or some JavaScript in the theme.

We will be in touch.

Hi Heath

Beaver Builder > Templates > KEEP AS DRAFT In Stock - Clearance

I agree the site should run fine given the resources available.

Cheers

Okay - thanks for the prompt reply Heath - we have to go live tomorrow morning and still can't upload anything on the Clearance page (in Draft).

We have ads out so if it's not running, it will be quite a disaster 😬

Warm regards
Penny Camplisson
Founder & Owner
Osier Belle Pty Ltd

Good Morning Penny and Allan,

We are looking into this again for you this morning as a priority.

Allan, thanks for the extra detail below:

Running a debug tool over one of the pages I get the following...
Fatal error: Allowed memory size of 536870912 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate 3279040 bytes) in /www/osierbellenew_962/public/wp-includes/class-wpdb.php on line 2397

Allan, can you please let us know what page you were editing when this happened? This may help us to isolate what is causing this issue.

Penny, regarding your care plan, this is for the provision of our powerful hosting in Google's data centres, WordPress updates and monitoring for security, uptime and performance checks. If the site crashes during an edit, the front end (public view) of the site stays live. Our monitoring checks if the public view is live. If the backend is crashing you/the devs/we will know about it and can investigate. Those crashes are the result of some action that is being taken, so are not monitored. We do log the error messages though.

In our experience, we run sites that are far more complex with far more traffic and the sites don't skip a beat. There is more than likely something within the websites code or settings or a plugin that is causing this issue. The solution of throwing more compute power at the server is only a bandaid, we need to get to the core of the issue for you. I'll keep you updated.

Morning Joel and Heath - I'm a little perplexed; the plan we have paid for WolfIQ services is to manage and maintain our website's performance.

We've had to reach out to find out why it keeps crashing whilst building (not the first time in recent months) and you are confirming now the server settings are at their max.

Wouldn't your constant monitoring alert you, and therefore contact us, to advise what we need to do before it affects us modifying/expanding our website?

We are trying to create a clearance sale that is time sensitive and the server being at max capacity has caused frustrating delays we have no control over.

Jess and the team have been trying to upload, with time restrictions, without any luck and we have lost precious time.

What's the solution?

Warm regards
Penny Camplisson
Founder & Owner
Osier Belle Pty Ltd

Hi Allan,

Sure, the server settings is now at max limit. Please see the attached.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath

Issues have returned when trying to access and edit large pages...

Running a debug tool over one of the pages I get the following...
Fatal error: Allowed memory size of 536870912 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate 3279040 bytes) in /www/osierbellenew_962/public/wp-includes/class-wpdb.php on line 2397

Is it possible to increase the PHP Memory Limit anymore or is it maxed out given the current hosting setup?

Cheers
